name: BOITATÁ - Xylography #06
description:
Boitatá is a flaming snake that protects the forests and fields. It is a typical Brazilian legend, of indigenous origin, that goes from the north to the south of the country. 
They say that it actually comes to explain the phenomenon known as "fogo-fátuo", which is the combustion of gases that escape from the ground.
If you encounter Boitatá, close your eyes and stop breathing! Otherwise you will be driven mad!
I have already seen one such phenomenon in the countryside. Thank goodness I know the legend of Boitatá.
